spell.name: Clutch of Nyogtha
entries: A stream of vile shadowy energy extends from your outstretched hand, lacing toward a creature within range and forming a sustained stream between you and the target. The target must make Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage and becoming {@condition incapacitated} until the end of their next turn on a failure. On a success, the target takes half damage and is not {@condition incapacitated}. On each of your turns for the duration, you can use your action to maintain the link with the target, forcing them to make another Constitution save or take {@damage 4d6} necrotic damage and becoming {@condition incapacitated}, or halved on a success and able to act normally.
The spell ends if you use your action to do anything else, if the target is ever outside the spell’s range, or if the target has total cover from you.

If the target dies while under the effect of this spell, everything within a 10 foot radius is showered in gore as their chest bursts outward and their smoking, beating heart flies through the air and into the caster’s hand. On their next turn, the caster can use their action to eat some of the heart and regain {@dice 4d6} hit points. If the heart is not immediately eaten, it loses this property. Creatures that do not possess a heart are immune to this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage and heal increase by {@dice 1d6} per level above 3rd.

spell.name: Blood Fire

components.m: a vial of blood mixed with pitch

entries: You point at one creature that you can see within range and attempt to transform the blood inside their body into searing flame. That creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target takes {@damage 8d6} fire damage and {@damage 8d6} necrotic damage and is set internally ablaze until the spell ends. On a successful saving throw, the target takes half damage and is not set internally ablaze.

At the start of each of its turns while internally ablaze, the target takes {@damage 8d6} necrotic damage and {@damage 8d6} fire damage and becomes {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn. If it has fewer than five levels of {@condition exhaustion}, it also gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, it cannot take bonus actions or reactions or make more than one attack per turn, and whenever it attempts to expend a spell slot, it must make a Concentration check against your Spellcasting DC. On a failure, it cannot expend spell slots that turn.

A creature set internally ablaze by this spell must make another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves against this spell three times, the spell ends. If it fails saves three times, it instantly takes {@damage 8d6} necrotic damage, the spell ends, and the transformation becomes permanent a magical effect lingers inside the target's body. It will be incurably {@condition poisoned} and take {@damage 8d6} fire damage at the start of each of its turns until it dies. The successes and failures don’t need to be consecutive; keep track of both until the target collects three of a kind.
The permanent effect can be ended only by a Greater Restoration or a Dispel Magic cast at 9th-level.
A creature who dies while affected by this spell or by the permanent magical effect burns to ash.
Creatures that do not have blood are immune to this spell. This spell is also a Blood spell in addition to its other school.

spell.name: Aldeb's Burning Rune

m.text: a chunk of sulfurous rock and gold powder worth 50 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: A faintly glowing red rune becomes inscribed upon the surface of a container, door, or similar surface. Noticing this rune requires a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. The rune is permanent until dispelled or you use an action to remove it. When you place this rune, you choose whether it is triggered by the object being opened, held, or used. When someone other than you performs the triggering action with the inscribed object, the rune forces them to make a Dexterity saving throw as they are engulfed in flames. On a failure, they take {@damage 4d4} fire damage and are on fire. At the start of each of their following turns, the damage they take decreases by {@dice 2d4} until it reaches zero. On a success, the target does not continue to burn after the initial turn. The flames can be extinguished early by dousing the creature in water.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When casting this spell using a 3rd level spell slot, the initial damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Corrosive Pool
entries: A pool of acid that takes up no more than 400 square feet appears on the ground within range. The pool can take any shape the caster desires, to a minimum of 5 feet wide. When the pool appears, creatures that are within the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 6d6} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. The area of the pool is considered difficult terrain. Each subsequent turn, the first time a creature enters the pool or if it ends its turn there, it takes {@damage 6d6} acid damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage of the acid pool increases by {@dice 1d6}.

spell.name: Crawling Mass

components.m: the body of a small insect

entries: The caster, along with anything they are wearing, dissolves into a vile swarm of biting beetles or worms. While in this form, the caster’s game statistics, excluding mental abilities scores, are replaced by the statistics of this form. The target assumes the hit points of its new form, and when it reverts to its normal form, the creature returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce the creature's normal form to 0 hit points, it isn't knocked {@condition unconscious}.

spell.name: Crypt Swarm

components.m: a bat’s wing and a fingerbone

entries: You extend your hands and let loose a swarm of spectral bats or insects that fly in a 5 foot wide line out to 60 feet in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d8} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, the target also halves any healing they receive until the end of their next turn.
The swarm is incorporeal and can pass through partial cover, though it is stopped by total cover.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Extinguish
entries: Extinguish can be used to extinguish forest fires and other conflagrations. When you cast this spell, you choose up to five 20-foot cubes within range. Within the area of effect, all non magical fires are extinguished. The spell also dispels any fire spells in its area, though you must make a spellcasting ability check with a DC of 10 + the spell’s level.
Fire elementals within the area of the spell must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 6d6} cold damage, halved on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When casting this spell using a 4th level spell slot, you can target one additional 20-foot cube for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Fire Seeds

m.text: four acorns or eight holly berries

entries: When you cast this spell, you select one of two options depending on the materials you use, acorns or holly berries. The fire seeds will not explode while in your possession unless you intend them to. They become mundane seeds if the duration expires without them being expended.

Acorn Grenades: Using this option, four acorns turn into special bombs, each of which can be hurled as an action as far as 90 feet. Each acorn explodes upon impact, forcing creatures in a 10 foot radius to make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 5d6} fire damage, halved on a success. The flames spread around corners and ignite all flammable objects not being worn or carried.

Holly Berry Bombs: Using this option, you turn eight holly berries into special bombs. The holly berries are usually placed by hand, since they are too light to make effective thrown weapons (they can be tossed only 5 feet). If you are within 200 feet and use an action to speak a command phrase, each berry instantly bursts into flame, forcing creatures in a 5-foot radius to make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} fire damage, halved on a success. The flames instantly ignite flammable objects within the radius.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When casting this spell with a 6th level spell slot or higher, the number of fire seeds you can make increases by one for either option for each level above 5th.

spell.name: Flames of Damnation
entries: Your arm is enveloped in red-violet fire as you evoke the name of Aldeb, the cursed flame. Make a ranged spell attack. The attack deals {@damage 7d8} fire damage on a hit as a lance of fire arcs toward the target. The caster takes half the fire damage dealt by the attack. On each of your following turns for the duration, you may use a bonus action to make another ranged spell attack and take half the damage yourself on a hit. Damage taken in this way does not require you to make a check to maintain concentration. If you are reduced to 0 HP by this spell, your arm is horribly scorched and charred as it crumbles away, and can only be restored by a regenerate.

Hellfire: The Lord of Cania can grant the unnatural ability of hellfire to his followers. When used by followers of Mephistopheles, this spell gains the Hellfire property. Fire damage dealt by this spell ignores resistance to fire damage and treats immunity to fire damage as resistance.

spell.name: Forcewave
entries: Two arcane shockwaves emanate from your body in all directions. When hit by the first wave, creatures in a 20 foot radius around the caster must succeed on a dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 5d6} force damage. A creature takes half as much damage on a successful save. When hit by the second wave, huge or smaller creatures must succeed on a strength save or be pushed 15 feet directly away from the caster and be knocked {@condition prone}.

spell.name: Freezing Cloud
entries: You create a 30 foot radius cloud of freezing air centered on a point you can see within range. Everything within this cloud is heavily obscured by an opaque white fog. Creatures that enter the fog for the first time on their turn or start their turn there must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 5d8} cold damage, halved on a success.

When you cast this spell, you may choose whether the cloud slowly moves away from you. The cloud moves 10 feet directly away from where you cast the spell in a direction that you choose at the start of each of your turns.

Creatures within the cloud have their movement speed halved. The cloud leaves a layer of icy rime on solid surfaces. Any creature that ends their turn within the cloud must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or fall {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast with a 7th level spell slot or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 6th.

spell.name: Hellscream
entries: You issue an earth-shaking, howling scream that carries the cries of tortured souls. A blue-white fire spews forth from your open mouth in a 60 foot cone. All creatures within the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save they take {@damage 7d6} fire damage and {@damage 7d6} thunder damage, are {@condition deafened} for 1 minute, and are knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the damage is halved and they suffer no other effects. Upon casting this spell, the caster must succeed a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer a level of {@condition exhaustion} and lose the ability to speak until they complete a short or long rest, or are healed by at least a greater restoration.

Hellfire: The Lord of Cania can grant the unnatural ability of hellfire to his followers. When used by followers of Mephistopheles, this spell gains the Hellfire property. Fire damage dealt by this spell ignores resistance to fire damage and treats immunity to fire damage as resistance.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, both the fire and thunder damage increase by {@dice 1d6}.

spell.name: Immolating Touch
entries: Fire engulfs your hand as you try to touch a creature. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes fire damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier. The creature must succeed on a dexterity saving throw or be briefly set ablaze taking {@damage 1d4} fire damage at the start of its next turn.

This spell's damage increases when you reach higher levels. At 5th level, both the melee attack and the burning damage do an extra {@damage 1d4} fire damage to the target. Both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d4} at 11th and 17th levels.

spell.name: Investiture of the Phoenix
entries: Your form becomes writhing flames. You gain resistance to fire damage. As a bonus action, you can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. All creatures within 10 feet of your teleportation destination must a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 4d8} fire damage. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage.

spell.name: Kiss of Brine

m.text: a vial of salt water and a pearl worth 100 gp

entries: You point at a target within range and they feel an icy rush crash over their body like a freezing ocean wave. The target must make a Constitution saving throw or begin hacking and coughing as their lungs fill with cold seawater, taking {@damage 3d10} necrotic damage, becoming {@condition incapacitated}, and unable to speak until the end of their next turn. On a success they take half damage and do not suffer any other effects. Creatures that do not have lungs, can breathe water, or do not need to breathe are immune to this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Lightning Leap
entries: You briefly dematerialize yourself into raw electrical energy and zip your way to a point you see within range. You gain energy with the distance you travel, until you burst out at your destination with a crack of thunder. Every creature in a 5 foot line between you and your destination point, and within a 10 foot radius of the destination must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 1d6} lighting damage per 10 feet you've traveled before meeting them on a failed save, or half on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When casting this spell using a 5th level spell slot, the range you can travel increases by 10 feet per level above 4th.

spell.name: Lullaby
entries: You play a soft lullaby laced with subtle magic targeting up to four creatures within range. Targets must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or become drowsy and inattentive. Those affected by this spell are {@condition incapacitated} and have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks and have a -5 penalty to their passive Perception.

Each round, you must use your action to maintain the spell. Noticing this spell is exceptionally difficult, and requires a successful Wisdom (Perception) check against your spell save DC. If a target of this spell ever leaves it's range or is attacked, the spell ends on them. Creatures that are immune to charms are immune to this effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 3rd level spell slot or higher, you can target two additional creatures for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Mind Fog
entries: Mind Fog produces a thin bank of mist in a 20-foot radius in range, which clouds the mind and hampers the mental fortitude of those caught in it. All creatures that enter the area for the first time on their turn or end their turn there must succeed a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature has a -5 penalty to all Intelligence and Wisdom checks and saving throws. This effect lasts until they end their turn outside the area of the fog.
The fog can be dispelled early if a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

spell.name: Moment of Prescience
entries: This spell grants you a momentary burst of sixth-sense in relation to yourself. When you cast this spell as a reaction to an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you add +15 to the roll. Alternatively, you may add +15 to your AC against any single attack. You may decide to use this spell after the die is rolled, but before the outcome is determined.

spell.name: Phase Door
entries: This spell creates an ethereal passage five feet wide and eight feet tall through wooden, plaster, or stone walls, but not other materials. The phase door is {@condition invisible} and inaccessible to all creatures except you, and only you can use the passage. The door allows you to pass through as much as 30 feet of solid material. If there is not an open space within 30 feet of the other side of the wall you cast this spell on, it fails. You disappear when you enter the phase door and appear at the exit. The phase door can be used eight times before it disappears and the spell ends.

If you desire, you can take one other creature (Medium or smaller) through the door. This counts as two uses of the door. The door does not allow light, sound, or spell effects through it, nor can you see through it without using it. Thus, the spell can provide an escape route, though certain creatures, such as phase spiders, can follow with ease. A gem of true seeing or similar magic reveals the presence of a phase door but does not allow its use.

You can allow other creatures to use the phase door by setting some triggering condition for the door. Such conditions can be as simple or elaborate as you desire. They can be based on a creature’s name, identity, or alignment, but otherwise must be based on observable actions or qualities.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using an 8th level spell slot, the number of times you can use the door increases by two for each level above 7th.

spell.name: Polar Ray
entries: You release a ray of blue-white freezing energy towards a creature within range . Make a ranged spell attack, dealing {@damage 6d10 + 25} cold damage on a successful hit. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points by this spell, they are frozen solid and encased in a solid block of ice a foot thick.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 7th level spell slot or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} for each spell slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Prying Eyes
entries: You create 10 semi-tangible, visible magical orbs (called “eyes”) These eyes move out, scout around, and return as you direct them when casting the spell. Each eye can see 120 feet (normal vision only) in all directions. While the individual eyes are quite fragile, they’re small and difficult to spot. Each eye is a Tiny construct, about three inches in diameter, that has 1 hit point, AC 18, flies at a speed of 30 feet, and has a +12  Dexterity (Stealth) modifier. It has a Wisdom (Perception) of +8 and is subject to illusions, darkness, fog, and any other factors that would affect your ability to receive visual information about your surroundings. An eye traveling through darkness must find its way by touch, and can squeeze through gaps as narrow as 1 inch.

When you create the eyes, you specify instructions you want them to follow in a command of no more than twenty-five words. Any knowledge you possess is known by the eyes as well, so if you know, for example, what a typical merchant looks like, the eyes do as well.

A sample command: “Surround me at a range of four hundred feet and return if you spot any dangerous creatures.” The phrase “Surround me” directs the eyes to form an equally spaced, horizontal ring at whatever range you indicate, and then move with you. As eyes return or are destroyed, the rest automatically space themselves to compensate. In the case of this sample command, an eye returns only if it spots a creature you would regard as dangerous. A “peasant” that is actually a shape changed dragon wouldn’t trigger an eye’s return. Ten eyes can form a ring with a radius of 400 feet and between them-selves see everything that crosses the ring.

Another sample command: “Spread out and search the town for Arweth. Follow him for three minutes, staying out of sight, and then return.” The phrase “Spread out” directs the eyes to move away from you in all directions. In this case, each eye would separately follow Arweth for three minutes once it spots him.

Other commands that might be useful include having eyes form a line in a certain manner, making them move at random within a certain range, or having them follow a certain type of creature. The DM is the final judge of the suitability of your directions.

In order to report their findings, the eyes must return to your hand. Each replays in your mind all it has seen during its existence. It takes an eye 1 round to replay1 hour of recorded images. After relaying its findings, an eye disappears. If an eye ever gets more than 1 mile away from you, it instantly ceases to exist. However, your link with the eye is such that you won’t know if the eye was destroyed because it wandered out of range or because of some other event. The eyes exist for up to 8 hours or until they return to you. Dispel magic can destroy the eyes.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 6th level spell slot, you can create two more eyes for each level above 5th.

spell.name: Ray of Hellfire
entries: Hellfire engulfs your body, shedding bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet for the spell's duration.

When you cast this spell and on subsequent turns, you can use your action to throw a gout of flames from your hand in a 5-foot-wide, 60-foot-long line. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 6d8} fire damage, taking half as much on a successful save.

Hellfire: The Lord of Cania can grant the unnatural ability of hellfire to his followers. When used by followers of Mephistopheles, this spell gains the Hellfire property. Fire damage dealt by this spell ignores resistance to fire damage and treats immunity to fire damage as resistance.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} per level above 5th.

spell.name: Refuge

m.text: (a specially prepared object, whose construction requires  gems worth 1,500 gp

entries: You create powerful magic in some specially prepared object—a statuette, a jeweled rod, a gem, or the like. This object contains the power to instantly transport its possessor across any distance within the same plane to your abode. Once the item is transmuted, you must give it willingly to a creature and at the same time inform it of a command word to be spoken when the item is used. To make use of the item, the subject speaks the command word at the same time that it tears or breaks the item (a standard action). When this is done, the individual and all objects it is wearing and carrying (to a maximum of the character’s heavy load) are instantly transported to a safe place designated by you when casting this spell. No other creatures are affected (aside from a familiar that is touching the subject).
The location you designate must be an enclosed area, such as a house, where you've spent at least one long rest in the past month.

You can alter the spell when casting it so that it transports you to within 10 feet of the possessor of the item when it is broken and the command word spoken. You will have a general idea of the location and situation of the item possessor at the time the refuge spell is discharged, but once you decide to alter the spell in this fashion, you have no choice whether or not to be transported.

spell.name: Screen
entries: This spell combines several elements to create a powerful protection from scrying and direct observation in a 100-foot cube. When casting the spell, you dictate what will and will not be observed within the target area. The illusion created must be stated in general terms. Thus, you could specify the illusion of yourself and another character playing chess for the duration of the spell, but you could not have the illusory chess players take a break, make dinner, and then resume their game. You could have a crossroads appear quiet and empty even while an army is actually passing through the area. You could specify that no one be seen (including passing strangers), that your troops be undetected, or even that every fifth person or unit should be visible. Once the conditions are set, they cannot be changed.

Attempts to scry the area automatically detect the image stated by you with no save allowed. Sight and sound are appropriate to the illusion created. A band of people standing in a meadow could be  concealed as an empty meadow with birds chirping, for instance. Direct observation may allow a save (as per a normal illusion), if there is cause to disbelieve what is seen. Certainly onlookers in the area would become suspicious if a marching army disappeared at one point to reappear at another. Even entering the area does not cancel the illusion or necessarily allow a save, assuming that hidden beings take care to stay out of the way of those affected by the illusion.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At Higher Levels. When casting this spell using an 8th level spell slot, the size of the cube increases by 100 feet per level above 7th.

spell.name: Silverflame's Hellish Transformation

m.text: an object engraved with a symbol of the lower planes, worth at least 500 gp

entries: Uttering an incantation, you draw on the magic of the Lower Planes to transform your being. You gain the following benefits until the spell ends.,

items: You have resistance to fire, cold, and poison damage.
You gain a pair of fiery wings that grant a flight speed of 60 feet.
Your skin gains a covering of tough red scales that grant +2 AC.
You have advantage constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration.
On your turn as your action, you can make two melee spell attacks that each do {@damage 4d8} fire damage.

entries: Immediately after this spell ends, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

Hellfire: The Lord of Cania can grant the unnatural ability of hellfire to his followers. When used by followers of Mephistopheles, this spell gains the Hellfire property. Fire damage dealt by this spell ignores resistance to fire damage and treats immunity to fire damage as resistance.

spell.name: Silverflame's Scathing Missile
entries: You strike with a shimmering bolt of flame and force at one target you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against it. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8 + 15} fire damage and {@damage 4d8 + 15} force damage, and they must succeed a Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn. This spell ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or above the fire and force damage dealt both increase by {@dice 2d8} for each level above 7th.

spell.name: Snap Freeze

components.m: a small metal vial of salt

entries: You spray forth a jet of freezing liquid far colder than any natural ice. Each creature in a 60 foot line must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 5d8} cold damage, or half on a success, and have their movement reduced by 10 feet until the end of their next turn. On a failed save, the target is also {@condition restrained} as ice coats their body. Each round, the target may use an action to make a strength saving throw, ending the condition on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast with a 4th level spell slot or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 5th.

spell.name: Solid Fog
entries: This spell functions like fog cloud, but in addition to obscuring vision, the fog is supernaturally dense such that any creature attempting to pass through it uses five feet of movement for every foot of progress, and melee attack rolls within the fog are made at disadvantage.

The vapors prevent the passage of any ranged projectiles, magical or otherwise. A creature that falls through solid fog is slowed, so that each 10 feet of vapor that it passes through reduces falling damage by {@dice 1d6}.
However, unlike normal fog, only a severe wind (31+ mph) will disperse these vapors, and do so in 1 round.

spell.name: Song of Discord
entries: TCreatures in a 30-foot radius within range must make a Wisdom saving throw or begin attacking each-other. A creature that had failed the save has a 50% chance of moving toward and attacking the nearest creature regardless of its identity at the beginning of each of their turns. A creature that is not forced to attack can move and act freely that round. Creatures immune to charms are immune to this effect.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When casting this spell using a 9th level spell slot, a creature that fails it's saving throw must always attack the nearest enemy each round for the duration.

spell.name: Spectral Force
entries: You craft an illusion that takes root in the mind of a creature that you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, you create a phantasmal object, creature, or other visible phenomenon of your choice that is no larger than a 30-foot cube and that is perceivable only to the target for the duration. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
The phantasm includes sound, temperature, and other stimuli, also evident only to the creature.

The target can use its action to examine the phantasm with an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If the check succeeds, the target realizes that the phantasm is an illusion, and the spell ends.

While a target is affected by the spell, the target treats the phantasm as if it were real. The target rationalizes any illogical outcomes from interacting with the phantasm. For example, a target attempting to walk across a phantasmal bridge that spans a chasm falls once it steps onto the bridge. If the target survives the fall, it still believes that the bridge exists and comes up with some other explanation for its fall—it was pushed, it slipped, or a strong wind might have knocked it off.

An affected target is so convinced of the phantasm's reality that it can even take damage from the illusion. A phantasm created to appear as a creature can attack the target. Similarly, a phantasm created to appear as fire, a pool of acid, or lava can burn the target. Each round on your turn, the phantasm can deal {@damage 4d6} psychic damage to the target if it is in the phantasm's area or within 5 feet of the phantasm, provided that the illusion is of a creature or hazard that could logically deal damage, such as by attacking. The target perceives the damage as a type appropriate to the illusion.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the illusion affects and is perceivable by one additional creature for each level above 5th. When affecting multiple creatures, the phantasm can interact with each creature individually while maintaining the validity of the illusion, but the nature of the phantasm must be the same.

spell.name: Stone Tell
entries: You gain the ability to speak with stones, which relate to you who or what has touched them as well as revealing what is covered or concealed behind or under them. The stones relate complete descriptions if asked. A stone’s perspective, perception, and knowledge may prevent the stone from providing the details you are looking for (as determined by the DM). You can speak with natural or worked stone.

spell.name: Stormborne Ascension

m.text: A sapphire worth 500gp that has been struck by lightning

entries: Focusing on your elemental powers, you channel your powers into transforming yourself into a warrior of storms. You gain the following benefits:

items: You have resistance to lightning, thunder, and cold damage.
You wreathed in swirling winds that grant a flight speed of 60 feet.
You have advantage constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration.

On your turn as your action, you can create a staff of raw lightning to make two melee spell attacks against creatures within 10 feet of you, dealing {@damage 3d10} lightning damage on a successful hit.

You gain a shield of swirling storm energy in your off hand which grants you +3 AC and acts as a Spellcasting focus. Whenever you deal lightning damage while wielding this shield, creatures within 15 feet of you take {@damage 1d4} thunder damage.

entries: Immediately after this spell ends, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion}.

spell.name: Tree Shape
entries: You assume the form of a Large living tree or shrub or a Large dead tree trunk with a small number of limbs. The closest inspection cannot reveal that the tree in question is actually a magically concealed creature. To all normal tests you are, in fact, a tree or shrub, although a detect magic spell reveals a faint transmutation on the tree. While in tree form, you retain your hit points, and can observe all that transpires around you just as if you were in your normal form.
In tree form your AC is 15, you cannot move or cast spells, and you are resistant to all forms of damage. You may exit tree form at any time, similar to dropping concentration.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 5th or 6th level spell slot, the duration is 24 hours. When you cast this spell using a 7th or 8th level spell slot, the duration is a week. When cast using a 9th level spell slot, this spell lasts until dispelled or you choose to end it.

spell.name: Wall of Flesh
entries: You create a tough, quivering wall of warm flesh covered in corrosive mucus that rapidly grows on a surface within range. You can form a hemispherical dome or a sphere with a radius of up to 10 feet, or you can shape a flat surface made up of ten 10 foot square panels. Each panel must be contiguous with another panel. In any form, the wall is 1 foot thick and lasts for the duration.

If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature within its area is pushed to one side of the wall and must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 4d8} acid damage, or half as much on a successful save.

The wall is an object that can be damaged and thus breached. It has an AC of 13 and 50 hit points per 5-foot section, and regenerates 10 hit points at the start of each of your turns so long as it didn't take fire damage that round. Reducing a 5-foot section of the wall to 0 hit points destroys it and leaves a torrent of spraying acid blood in the space the wall occupied. A creature moving through this space must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 6d8} acid damage on a failure, or half on a success. If the wall has not taken fire damage this round, the two adjacent 5-foot sections of wall grow to refill the gap at the start of your turn, creating a new section with 10 hit points.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At Higher Levels. When casting this spell with a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the hit point maximum of the wall increases by 10 for each level above 6th.

spell.name: Wall of Hellfire
entries: A wall of infernal flames appears at a point you choose within range. The wall appears in any orientation you choose: horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. It can be free floating, or it can rest on a solid surface. The wall can be up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 10 feet thick. The wall blocks line of sight, but creatures and objects can pass through it. It emits bright light out to 60 feet and dim light for an additional 60 feet.

When the wall appears, each creature in its area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 3d8} fire damage or half as much on a successful save. A creature that starts its turn in the wall's area takes {@damage 3d8} fire damage.

Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action to launch a bolt of flames from the wall at one creature you can see within 60 feet of it. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8} fire damage.  The attack is made with advantage if the target is inside the wall.

Hellfire: The Lord of Cania can grant the unnatural ability of hellfire to his followers. When used by followers of Mephistopheles, this spell gains the Hellfire property. Fire damage dealt by this spell ignores resistance to fire damage and treats immunity to fire damage as resistance.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, both instances of damage increase by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Witches Stitches
entries: One creature of your choice that you can see within range must succeed a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, their mouth is immediately and painfully sewn shut with magical glowing thread. On each of their turns, the creature may use their action to attempt to cut the string with a sharp weapon. When they do this, they must make a Strength check versus your spell save DC. On a success, or when the spell ends, the string rapidly unravels and dissipates

spell.name: Withering

components.m: a pinch of dust and a strip of white cloth

entries: You twist a creature’s body that you can see within range with a blast of withering energy, attempting to sap all life force from a portion of them. Upon casting this spell, choose one of the target’s limbs. They take {@damage 6d6} necrotic damage and must succeed a Constitution saving throw or immediately have that limb become within and shrunken to uselessness, and have their strength and dexterity reduced to 3 as their body goes numb and tingly. This effect is permanent and can only be ended by greater restoration, regenerate, heal, or wish.

spell.name: Ice Sculpture
entries: You conjure a magical chunk of ice into an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The ice created must be no larger than a 10-foot cube, and the ice must be of a form that you have seen before, though the form need not have been made of ice when you saw it. This spell cannot create complicated machinery with moving parts, such as a clock or firearm. When you cast the spell, you also choose whether the ice is clear and transparent or cloudy and heavily obscured.

The ice has hit points equal to {@dice 5d8} + twice your spellcasting modifier (minimum 5 hit points), and its AC is equal to 10 + your spellcasting modifier. It has immunity to cold damage, but it has vulnerability to bludgeoning, fire, and thunder damage. The ice object is destroyed when it reaches 0 hit points or the spell ends.
The ice melts after {@dice 2d4} minutes in a hot environment, and only 1 minute in an extremely hot environment.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the hit points of the ice increase by {@dice 2d8} for each slot level above 2nd, and the maximum size of the object increases by 5 feet for every 3 slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Molten Upheaval

components.m: igneous rock carved into a hammer

entries: Choose a point you can see on the ground within range.The ground bursts with molten geysers in a 40 foot cube centered on that point. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 6d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Cracks and fissures filled with molten lava open up in the area and chum the remaining solid earth, making the ground in the area difficult terrain until the spell ends. Any creature that enters the spell's area for the first time on a tum or ends its tum in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 6d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful save. Creatures that aren't in or on the ground automatically succeed on this saving throw, but {@condition prone} creatures make this saving throw with disadvantage. This spell ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

When the spell ends, the ground in the area cools and solidifies, becoming difficult terrain until cleared. Each 5-foot-square portion of ground in the area requires at least 10 minutes to clear using mason's tools.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the fire damage dealt increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Obliteration Beam

m.text: a diamond worth at least 800gp

entries: You emit a massive beam of bright, powerful energy in a line 500 feet long and 25 feet wide that blasts away all in its deadly path. Each creature within the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 11d10} radiant damage and {@damage 11d10} force damage, is pushed 50 feet away from you, and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and is not pushed or knocked {@condition prone}. Until the end of your next tum, the area emits bright light for 500 feet and dim light for an additional 500 feet. The spell damages and pushes objects in the area.

spell.name: Ray of Fatigue
entries: A purple coil of energy streaks from your hand toward a creature you can see within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 5d8} necrotic damage and gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}, and until the spell ends, the target suffers the penalties for at least 3 levels of {@condition exhaustion} at all times unless it is immune to {@condition exhaustion}.

At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell ends. Exhaustion caused by this spell is removed from a creature when it finishes a short or long rest with food and water to snack on.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Shield Other

time.condition: which you take when a creature other than you within range that you can see is hit by an attack or targeted by the magic missile spell

entries: A shimmering barrier of magical force appears and protects the attacked creature. Until the start of your next turn, the target has a +4 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and it takes no damage from magic missile.

spell.name: Shield of Glory
entries: With a barked word you call attention to and magically glaze the front of a shield (which is the key component for the spell) to a polished enchanted reflection. For the duration of the spell your shield gives off bright light for 20 feet and dim light for an additional 20 feet, and grants you an extra + 1 bonus to AC.

In addition, while the spell is active, each enemy within 10 feet of you that can see you must make a Charisma saving throw when it starts its turn. On a failed saving throw, that creature cannot move further away from you, make an attack that does not target you, or cast a spell that targets other creatures but does not target you, lasting until the start of its next turn.

Creatures that cannot be {@condition charmed}, that are {@condition blinded}, that have 4 Intelligence or less, or that have no reflection are immune to the effects of this spell. If you stop holding the shield the spell ends immediately.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level, the radius of the saving throw effect, the bright light, and the dim light increases by 10 feet and the bonus to AC increases by +1.

spell.name: Soul Blade
entries: You create a glowing blade of magical force in your free hand, made from a small piece of your soul The blade is similar in size and shape to a longsword, and it lasts for the duration. If you let go of the blade, it disappears, but you can summon the blade again as a bonus action.

You can use your action to make a melee spell attack with the soul blade. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d10} force damage plus {@damage 3d10} radiant damage (if you are good or neutral) or {@damage 3d10} necrotic damage (if you are evil), which ignores resistance. If the target is an incorporeal undead (such as a ghost) or a soul removed from its body, the attack deals maximum damage and ignores immunity.

The blade sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. A creature killed by this spell has its soul injured, and cannot be restored to life except by a true resurrection or wish spell.

You can use a bonus action to end the spell early. If the spell ends for any other reason, you lose the fragment of your soul the blade was formed from, causing you to take {@damage 6d6} necrotic damage and gain one level of {@condition exhaustion}. This damage cannot be prevented or reduced and it ignores resistance and immunity.

spell.name: Steam Strike
entries: You launch a blast of scalding hot steam that curls and billows in the direction of one creature or object that you can see within range. Make a spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 12d4} fire damage and must make a Constitution saving throw, becoming {@condition blinded} on a failure. At the end of each of its turns, it can repeat the Constitution saving throw, ending the blindness on a success. Hit or miss, the target's space is filled with steam and mist that makes it lightly obscured until the end of your next turn.

spell.name: Swift Ward

time.condition: which you take just before you would take damage

entries: You ward yourself with a hasty and impermanent barrier of magical energy to protect against oncoming danger, granting you protection until the start of your next turn.

The ward has hit points equal to {@dice 6d6} + your Spellcasting ability modifier. If you would take damage, the ward blocks and takes the damage instead. The ward cannot block psychic or poison damage. If the ward is reduced to 0 hit points, you take any remaining damage and the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the ward hit points increase by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Wall of Lava
entries: You create a wall of fire on a solid surface within range. You can make the wall up to 100 feet long, 30 feet high, and 3 feet thick, or a ringed wall up to 50 feet in diameter, 30 feet high, and 5 feet thick. The wall is opaque, gives off dim light for 30 feet, and lasts for the duration.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes {@damage 10d8} fire damage and is {@condition restrained} by the wall After it appears, creatures that enter the wall's space for the first time on a turn or that touch the wall must make the same Dexterity saving throw and suffer the same effects on a failed saving throw. If the creature touched the wall it alsotakes half damage on a successful saving throw.

Creatures can enter and move through the wan but they must spend 6 feet of movement for every 1 foot moved through the wall. Any creature that touches the wall or ends its turn inside the wall must make a Strength saving throw, becoming {@condition restrained} by the wall on a failed saving throw. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the wall takes {@damage 5d8} fire damage, or {@damage 10d8} fire damage if its {@condition restrained} by or inside
the wall A {@condition restrained} creature can use an action on its turn to attempt to escape. It makes a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.

Spells that deal more than 20 cold damage that pass through the wall cause the area of the wall they pass through to freeze into solid obsidian glass (at least a 5-foot square section is frozen~ Each 5-foot-square obsidian section has AC 12 and 30 hit points and is vulnerable to thunder damage. Reducing an obsidian section to 0 hit points destroys it. When a section is destroyed, the wall's lava doesn't fill it. This spell ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried. If you maintain your concentration on this spell for its whole duration, the wall hardens into permanent obsidian stone and can't be dispelled instead of vanishing. Without the spell's magic, the destruction of these panels might now cause connected panels to collapse at the DM's discretion.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 9th level the damage dealt by being near the wall increases by {@dice 1d8} and all other damage rolls for the spell increase by {@dice 2d8}.

spell.name: Finger of Death (Improved)
entries: You send negative energy coursing through a creature that you can see within range, causing it searing pain. The target must make a Constitution saving throw. It takes {@damage 9d8 + 30} necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
A humanoid killed by this spell rises at the start of your next turn as a {@creature zombie} that is permanently under your command, following your verbal orders to the best of its ability.

spell.name: Fire Storm (Improved)
entries: A storm made up of sheets of roaring flame appears in a location you choose within range. The area of the storm consists of up to ten 20-foot cubes, which you can arrange as you wish. Each cube must have at least one face adjacent to the face of another cube. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes {@damage 8d10} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The fire damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried. If you choose, plant life in the area is unaffected by this spell.

spell.name: Investiture of Flame (Improved)
entries: Flames race across your body, shedding bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet for the spell's duration. The flames don't harm you. Until the spell ends, you gain the following benefits:

items: You are immune to fire damage and have resistance to cold damage.
Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of you takes {@damage 2d10} fire damage.

You can use your action to create a line of fire 30 feet long and 5 feet wide extending from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 5d8} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spell.name: Flash
entries: You burst with blinding light that shines briefly from your skin before fading away. Every creature within range must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature is {@condition blinded} until the start of your next turn.
Until the end of your next turn, you shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

spell.name: Jinx

components.m: a shard of a shattered mirror

entries: You incant and point at one creature you can see within range, cursing it with a premonition of horrible luck. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target is cursed until the spell ends. While affected by this curse, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.
A creature cursed by this spell repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the spell on a success.

spell.name: Cold Snap
entries: With a snap of your fingers you banish heat from a target. There are two possible uses for the spell, targeting either one creature that you can see within range or targeting an area of liquid — such as water, acid, mud, snow, quicksand, or lava.

If you target a creature, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target takes {@damage 5d10} cold damage and it is {@condition restrained} until the end of your next turn. In addition, it gains one level of {@condition exhaustion} unless it has resistance or immunity to the spell's damage. On a success, it only takes half damage and it doesn't suffer any other effects from the spell.

If you target an area, your magic affects a portion of liquid that you can see within range and fits into a 30 foot cube. The affected liquid is frozen solid for 10 minutes, provided that there are no creatures in the area. Not all liquids lose their properties when frozen. For example, frozen lava may still be extremely hot to the touch, and frozen acid may still sting or even cause damage in extreme concentrations.
Exhaustion caused by this spell is removed from a creature when it finishes a short or long rest in a warm environment.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage dealt increases by {@dice 1d10} and the size of the cube increases by 10 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Dire Jinx

components.m: a shard of a shattered mirror

entries: You incant and point at one creature you can see within range, cursing it with a premonition of fatally bad luck. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the target is cursed until the spell ends. While affected by this curse, it suffers the following ailments:
• It takes maximum damage from all traps, environmental hazards (such as a pit of lava)  falls, and collisions.
• It has disadvantage on all saving throws, ability checks, and attack rolls that it makes.
• All attacks made against it have advantage and score a critical hit on a roll of 16-20.

A creature cursed by this spell must make another Charisma saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves against this spell two times, the spell ends. If it fails three times, it stops making saving throws against this curse. In addition, if you maintain concentration on this spell for the entire possible duration, the spell ends and the target becomes affected by a new curse with different effects. This new curse lasts for 30 days. While affected by this new long-lasting curse, the DM must roll a {@dice d20} for the target at each sunrise. On a 1, the target will meet with a dangerous encounter that day.

Examples: Falling off a steep cliff into choppy rapids; meeting drunk and angry bandits when out alone; being mistaken for a wanted criminal and taken for execution; experiencing a terrible magical accident in an academy or laboratory, etc. The encounter must have a total effective experience value equal to or greater than an encounter with a creature of challenge rating equal to the target's level or challenge rating + your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum rating of 6) but it doesn't have to be one that grants any actual experience.

At the end of the 30 days, the target repeats the Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the long-lasting curse remains for another 30 days and then the target repeats the saving throw again. On a success, the curse is removed.

spell.name: Soul Extraction
entries: You place a mark of dark magic on up to ten celestials, dragons, giants, and humanoids you can see within range. Creatures with an intelligence of 4 or less are unaffected by this spell. If any of the creatures die during the duration of the spell, their souls are captured in the gem used as the material component of the spell, increasing its value based on the  number of souls. The worth of the soul is based on the creatures CR, CR 0+: 50 gp CR 1+: 100 gp CR 5+: 1,000 gp CR 10+: 5,000 gp CR 15+: 10,000 gp CR 20+: 20,000 gp. Once improved, the gem glows faintly and a shifting silvery swirl can be seen inside it. The gem can be used as spellcasting components for any spell that requires a gem or gem dust of any kind. Once a creature’s soul is captured in a gem for 8 hours, or used as the material component of another spell, it cannot be resurrected by any means.

Casting Soul Extraction is a deeply evil act. A creature of non-evil alignment that casts this spell must immediately succeed on a DC 25 Charisma saving throw or have its alignment forcibly changed to neutral evil.

spell.name: Resonant Strikes
entries: You vanish from sight in a boom of thunder. You make a melee attack with the weapon used in casting against up to 5 creatures of your choice within a 20 foot radius of a point you choose within range. Attacks made in this manner do an extra {@damage 2d10} thunder damage on a hit. You reappear at the point you cast the spell at the start of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When cast using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the thunder damage increases by {@dice 1d10} and the maximum number of targets increases by 1 for each level above 4th.

spell.name: Leomund’s Hidden Lodge
entries: You conjure forth a sturdy camouflaged shelter that occupies a 20-foot square in range that lasts for the duration. You choose it's orientation and on which side its one entrance is located. The entrance is a sturdy wooden door of standard construction that melds with the structure when closed.

Within the structure is a clean cabin with a level floor of timber or stone, two shuttered windows, and a small fireplace. It is modestly furnished with eight bunks, a wooden table and chairs, and a writing desk. The structure is resistant to fire, but can otherwise be damaged by normal means. The atmosphere inside the space is comfortable and dry, regardless of the conditions outside.
The doors and windows of the shelter are secured with a magical password that you determine when casting the spell.

From the exterior, the lodge is camouflaged to blend in perfectly with the surroundings. It may, for example, appear as a house-sized boulder in a rocky landscape, a sand dune in the desert, a or dense thicket in a forest. The shelter also conceals any signs of habitation such as smoke, light, or sound from within.

Any creature that passes within 30 feet of the shelter may make a Wisdom (survival) check against your spell save DC to spot that it is a dwelling and not part of the natural landscape. Creatures familiar to the area have advantage on the check.

spell.name: Superior Invisibility
entries: You or a creature you touch becomes {@condition invisible} until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is {@condition invisible} as long as it is on the target's person.

For the duration of the spell, the target is also undetectable by scent and their vibrations are muffled against tremorsense. Sound cannot be created in a 5-foot radius around the target, preventing noise from their movements or the casting of spells with verbal components by creatures within the area. Exterior sounds can still pass through this area, and the target’s own voice is immune to this effect. Even if a creature can perceive the target they are always considered heavily obscured.

Targets of this spell cannot be revealed by anything less than truesight, though they can be detected by blindsight. They also may be detected by other mundane conditions such as footprints when appropriate.

spell.name: Bane Weapon

m.text: a weapon worth at least 1sp

entries: You enchant your weapon to strike down your foes. When you do so, select a type of enemy from the ranger's favored enemy list. For the duration, weapon attacks made with this weapon against the selected type of enemy gain a +2 bonus and deal an additional {@damage 2d6} force damage.
As an action on your turn, you can change the type of enemy your bane weapon effects to another option on the ranger's favored enemy list.

spell.name: Malign

time.condition: which you use upon hitting with a weapon attack

entries: Upon hitting with a weapon attack, you focus some of your own life force to infuse your attack with deadly force. You take 6 necrotic damage, which cannot be reduced or negated by any means and ignores temporary hit points. The weapon attack that triggered this spell then deals an additional {@damage 3d6} damage of the weapon’s type.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When casting this spell using a 3rd level spell slot, the damage you take increases by 2 and the damage dealt increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Quill Blast
entries: A flurry of sharp quills blast outward from you, forcing creatures within a 15-foot radius to make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 5d6} piercing damage, halved on a success. On a failed saving throw, creatures also have quills lodged in their skin which impose disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until they use an action to remove them.

spell.name: Chaos Meteor
entries: You hurl an undulating, warbling mass of chaotic energy at one creature in range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d6 + 2d8 + 1d12} damage. Choose one of the {@dice d6}s. The number rolled on that die determines what condition is applied and what saving throw must be made.  On a failed save, the target is affected by the condition until the end of their next turn. As shown below.
Now choose one of the {@dice d8}s. The number rolled on that die determines the attack's damage type, as shown below.

If you roll the same number on either both {@dice d6}s or both {@dice d8}s, the chaotic energy leaps from the target to a different creature of your choice within 60 feet of it. Make a new attack roll against the new target, and make a new damage roll, which could cause the chaotic energy to leap again.
A creature can be targeted only once by each casting of this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, each target takes {@damage 1d12} extra damage of the type rolled for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Chaos Bolt (Improved)
entries: You hurl an undulating, warbling mass of chaotic energy at one creature in range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d8 + 2d4} damage. Choose one of the {@dice d8}s. The number rolled on that die determines the attack's damage type, as shown below.

If you roll the same number on both {@dice d8}s, the chaotic energy leaps from the target to a different creature of your choice within 30 feet of it. Make a new attack roll against the new target, and make a new damage roll, which could cause the chaotic energy to leap again.
A creature can be targeted only once by each casting of this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, each target takes {@damage 2d4} extra damage of the type rolled for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Corpse Burst
entries: You select up to three dead creatures that you can see within range and cause them to rapidly bloat with acidic bile and explode. Creatures within a 20-foot radius of the explosions must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking {@damage 8d6} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one corpse burst is affected only once. This spell cannot target the corpses of constructs, elementals, oozes, or plants.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a 5th level spell or higher, the number of corpses you can cause to explode increases by one per level above 4th.

spell.name: Sphere of Annihilation

components.m: a lodestone and a pinch of dust)

entries: A 5-foot diameter sphere of non-reflective nothingness appears in a space of your choice within range and lasts for the duration. If a creature is occupying the space where you create the sphere, it must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take {@damage 14d10} force damage. The creature is then moved into an unoccupied space within 5 feet.

As a bonus action, you can cause the sphere to fly up to 30 feet within range. If you ram the sphere into a creature, it must make a saving throw against the sphere's damage, and the sphere stops moving this turn. The creature is disintegrated if the spell leaves them with 0 hit points.

A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.
When you move the sphere, it can move through solid objects as if they were difficult terrain, leaving a 5-foot circular tunnel in its wake.
The sphere counts as a disintegrate spell for the purpose of destroying a wall of force or any other spell or effect specifically affected by disintegrate.

spell.name: Programmed Telekinesis

m.text: diamond dust worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You create a telekinetic effect upon an object within range that activates when a specific condition occurs. The affected object can weigh no more than 1,000 pounds and you decide when you cast the spell how the object is affected and what movements occur. You can exert fine control on objects with this telekinesis, such as manipulating a simple tool, opening a door or a container, storing or retrieving an item from an open container, or pouring the contents from a vial. This scripted motions can last up to 5 minutes and move the object up to 30 feet from its original position.

When the condition you specify occurs, the telekinesis immediately grips the object and performs in the manner you described. Once the action finishes, the effect stops and becomes dormant for 10 minutes. After this time, the telekinesis can be activated again.

The triggering condition can be as general or as detailed as you like, though it must be based on visual or audible conditions that occur within 30 feet of the area. For example, you could create a telekinetic affect to carry a platform up a vertical shaft when stepped on, in the manner of an elevator, or you could set a telekinetic motion to only trigger when a creature says the correct word or phrase.

spell.name: Creeping Darkness
entries: Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 20-foot radius sphere for the duration. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with {@sense darkvision} can't see through this darkness, and non-magical light can't illuminate it. For the duration, no sound can be created within or pass through the sphere. Any creature or object entirely inside the sphere is immune to thunder damage, and creatures are {@condition deafened} while entirely inside it. Casting a spell that includes a verbal component is impossible there.
As a bonus action, you can cause the sphere to fly up to 20 feet. A solid barrier blocks the sphere's movement, but it can pass through an opening as small as 1 inch in diameter.

spell.name: Heart Ripper
entries: You utter a word and snap your fingers, targeting creatures of your choice within range with a sum total of 90 hit points or fewer. No single target can have a current number of hit points greater than 30. The targets instantly die as their hearts are forcibly ripped from their bodies by an {@condition invisible} force. This spell has no effect on undead, constructs, or creatures that do not have a heart.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the sum total of hit points increases by 20 for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Flensing
entries: You select a target within range and begin to strip the flesh from its body. The target must succeed a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target takes {@damage 7d6} slashing damage, cannot cast spells, and suffers disadvantage on Charisma and Constitution ability checks and saving throws as they are wracked with mind shattering pain. On a success, the damage is halved and the target does not suffer disadvantage.

On each of your turns for the duration, you can use your action to force the target to make another Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 7d6} slashing damage, being unable to cast spells, and suffering disadvantage on Charisma and Constitution on a failure, or half damage on a success. The spell ends if you use your action to do anything else or if the target is ever outside the spell's range.

If the target saves successfully against this spell three times, the spell ends. If the target fails its save three times, the disadvantage on Charisma and Constitution ability checks and saving throws becomes permanent as the target is irrevocably traumatized and scarred. The effect can be ended by a regenerate or wish.

spell.name: Spiritwall
entries: A wall of swirling greenish-white forms resembling tortured spirits appears at a point you choose within range. The wall appears in any orientation you choose: horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. It can be free floating, or it can rest on a solid surface. You choose to make the wall up to 60 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick or a circle that has a 20-foot diameter and is up to 20 feet high and 1 foot thick. The wall blocks line of sight, but creatures and objects can pass through it.

When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage and gains a level of {@condition exhaustion}, or half as much damage on a successful save. A creature must make this same saving throw when it enters the wall for the first time on its turn or ends its turn there.

One side of the wall, selected by you when you cast this spell, emits a low groaning that forces all creatures within 60 feet of that side to make a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute.  The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Any levels of {@condition exhaustion} caused by this spell go away when the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When casting this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the necrotic damage dealt increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 5th.

spell.name: Force Tether
entries: You create a ring of materialized force that orbits around you for the duration. As a bonus action, you may force a Huge or smaller creature within 30 feet to make a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC or be pulled up to 25 feet in a straight line toward you. Creatures affected by the shield spell automatically succeed on the saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When casting this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the maximum tether range and distance pulled increase by 10 feet.

spell.name: Protection From Outsiders
entries: For the duration, a willing creature you touch has resistance to one damage type of your choice: radiant, necrotic, or psychic.

spell.name: Immolation (Improved)
entries: Flames wreathe one creature you can see within range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes {@damage 8d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, the target also burns for the spell's duration. The burning target sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the saving throw. It takes {@damage 8d6} fire damage on a failed save, and the spell ends on a successful one. These magical flames can't be extinguished by nonmagical means.
If damage from this spell kills a target, the target is turned to ash.

spell.name: Phantasmal Force (Improved)
entries: You craft an illusion that takes root in the mind of a creature that you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, you create a phantasmal object, creature, or other visible phenomenon of your choice that is no larger than a 10-foot cube and that is perceivable only to the target for the duration. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
The phantasm includes sound, temperature, and other stimuli, also evident only to the creature.

The target can use its action to examine the phantasm with an Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check against your spell save DC. If the check succeeds, the target realizes that the phantasm is an illusion, and the spell ends.

While a target is affected by the spell, the target treats the phantasm as if it were real. The target rationalizes any illogical outcomes from interacting with the phantasm. For example, a target attempting to walk across a phantasmal bridge that spans a chasm falls once it steps onto the bridge. If the target survives the fall, it still believes that the bridge exists and comes up with some other explanation for its fall—it was pushed, it slipped, or a strong wind might have knocked it off.

An affected target is so convinced of the phantasm's reality that it can even take damage from the illusion. A phantasm created to appear as a creature can attack the target. Similarly, a phantasm created to appear as fire, a pool of acid, or lava can burn the target. Each round on your turn, the phantasm can deal {@damage 1d6} psychic damage to the target if it is in the phantasm's area or within 5 feet of the phantasm, provided that the illusion is of a creature or hazard that could logically deal damage, such as by attacking. The target perceives the damage as a type appropriate to the illusion.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the illusion affects and is perceivable by one additional creature for each level above 2nd. When affecting multiple creatures, the phantasm can interact with each creature individually while maintaining the validity of the illusion, but the nature of the phantasm must be the same.

spell.name: Power Word Stun (Improved)
entries: You speak a word of power that can overwhelm the mind of one creature you can see within range, leaving it dumbfounded. If the target has 150 hit points or fewer, it is {@condition stunned}. Otherwise, the spell has no effect. The duration of the spell is dependent on the target's current hit point total. If the target has 150 hit points or less, they are {@condition stunned} for {@dice 1d4} rounds. If they have 100 hit points or less, they are {@condition stunned} for {@dice 2d4} rounds. If they have 50 hit points or less, they are {@condition stunned} for {@dice 4d4} rounds.
The {@condition stunned} target must make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, this stunning effect ends.

spell.name: Hunger of Hadar (Improved)
entries: You open a gateway to the dark between the stars, a region infested with unknown horrors. A 20-foot-radius sphere of blackness and bitter cold appears, centered on a point within range and lasting for the duration. This void is filled with a cacophony of soft whispers and slurping noises that can be heard up to 30 feet away. No light, magical or otherwise, can illuminate the area, and creatures fully within the area are {@condition blinded}.

The void creates a warp in the fabric of space, and the area is difficult terrain. Any creature that starts its turn in the area takes {@damage 2d6} cold damage. Any creature that ends its turn in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} acid damage as milky, otherworldly tentacles rub against it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the cold damage or the acid damage (your choice) increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Ray of Enfeeblement (Improved)
entries: A black beam of enervating energy springs from your finger toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target deals only half damage with melee attacks until the spell ends.
At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

spell.name: Ice Storm (Improved)

components.m: a pinch of dust and a few drops of water

entries: A hail of rock-hard ice pounds to the ground in a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range. Each creature in the cylinder must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 2d8} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 5d6} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Hailstones turn the storm's area of effect into difficult terrain until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the bludgeoning damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d8|4-9|1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Bane (List)
entries: Up to three creatures of your choice that you can see within range must make Charisma saving throws. Whenever a target that fails this saving throw makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Ray of Sickness (List)
entries: A ray of sickening greenish energy lashes out toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d8} poison damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it is also {@condition poisoned} until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d8|1-9|1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Thunderwave (List)
